com.google.api.client.extensions.appengine.auth.helpers
Class AccessAppResource

java.lang.Object
  com.google.api.client.auth.oauth2.draft10.AccessProtectedResource
      com.google.api.client.extensions.appengine.auth.helpers.AccessAppResource

public class AccessAppResource
extends AccessProtectedResource

Subclass of AccessProtectedResource that handles the different logic required to obtain a new access token using an assertion grant when the existing one expires.

Since:
1.6
Author:
moshenko@google.com (Jake Moshenko)

Constructor Detail

AccessAppResource

public AccessAppResource(java.lang.String accessToken,
                         AccessProtectedResource.Method method,
                         HttpTransport transport,
                         JsonFactory jsonFactory,
                         java.lang.String authorizationServerUrl,
                         java.lang.String scope,
                         java.lang.String audience)
                  throws java.io.IOException
Create an instance of the access initializer.

Parameters:
accessToken - Initial access token, or null if one is not yet available.
method - Method with which to authorize the request.
transport - Instance used to communicate with the auth server.
jsonFactory - Instance used to deserialize communications from the auth server.
authorizationServerUrl - Url at which the auth server is located.
scope - Scope for which we are requesting access.
audience - Audience used in the JSON web token used when obtaining access tokens.
Throws:
java.io.IOException
Method Detail

executeRefreshToken

protected boolean executeRefreshToken()
                               throws java.io.IOException
Description copied from class: AccessProtectedResource
Request a new access token from the authorization endpoint.

If the refresh token grant parameter passed to the constructor was null, default implementation uses just always returns false. Otherwise, it uses AccessTokenRequest.RefreshTokenGrant based on the refresh token and then passes it to AccessProtectedResource.executeAccessTokenRequest(AccessTokenRequest) to execute.

Subclasses may override. Implementations can assume proper thread synchronization is already taken care of inside AccessProtectedResource.refreshToken(), where this is called from.

Overrides:
executeRefreshToken in class AccessProtectedResource
Returns:
whether a new access token was successfully retrieved
Throws:
java.io.IOException - I/O exception
